results.title: The Smell of war
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Julia Spark
results.brief_description: A segment from the television program “History in action”, this video is aimed at an audience of junior high school students through to adults. It is an investigation of the conditions and events leading to the spark that set off World War I. Includes rare archival footage.

results.title: The Smash
results.brief_description: Harry (Stephen Blackburn of Tim and Debbie) is a member of a pop group - The Smash. Unfortunately his careless driving ends with an accident resulting in injuries to himself and his lead singer, and excessive damage to his car and a parked car. This program teaches about the legal and insurance consequences of car accidents.

results.creator_credit: Fine Arts, Sterling Educational Films and Waller Reade
results.brief_description: Animated vcersion of Alvin Tresselt’s story of the adventures of an undersized elephant whose success in life is consolation for “small fry” of the world. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Small poppies
results.creator_credit: J D Productions, Artists Who Wash Cars and Robert Mack
results.brief_description: For the 2000 Dublin Theatre Festival, Sydney’s Company B Belvoir were invited to perform a production of “The Small Poppies”. This documentary traces the play’s rehearsal of a comic work, pitched at young children, about experiencing the first day at primary school. The cast is a bevy of well-regarded Australian actors, including David Field, Julie Forsyth, Deborah Mailman, Rebecca Massey, Arky Michael and Geoffrey Rush. Interviews are conducted with members of the audience, mostly small children, who humorously reminisce about their first day at school and consider why people create works and attend the theatre. Geoffrey Rush discusses theatre, his history as an actor, and desire to create a piece of theatre, back in 1986, about the first day at school, with playwright David Holman. Interviews with the cast, Holman and director Neil Armfield, are interspersed with black and white stills of Rush and Holman, from 1986, researching, visiting schools and observing young children first hand, much of which formed the finished play. Displaying rehearsals, discussions and processes that attribute to a successful play, makes for a fascinating view of collaborative art, and this documentary shows extended footage from the Dublin performance and what appears to be an extremely amusing and affecting work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J D Productions, Artists Who Wash Cars and Robert Mack

results.title: The Small one
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Don Bluth
results.brief_description: The Small One is a donkey, aptly named due to his size. Owned by a little boy, the donkey must be sold as he cannot match the workload of the other donkeys. Heartbroken, the boy takes the donkey into town to sell him, his main concern being to find him a good owner. The boy is disheartened when no-one is interested in his donkey, until he meets a man who has a special job for the small one- to carry his wife to Bethlehem. Based on the book by Charles Tazewell.

results.title: The Small one
results.brief_description: The Small One is a donkey, aptly named due to his size. Owned by a little boy, the donkey must be sold as he cannot match the workload of the other donkeys. Heartbroken, the boy takes the donkey into town to sell him, his main concern being to find him a good owner. The boy is disheartened when no-one is interested in his donkey, until he meets a man who has a special job for the small one- to carry his wife to Bethlehem. Based on the book by Charles Tazewell. This tape also includes; “Winter storage”, “The Night before Christmas”, “Santa’s workshop” and “Pluto’s Christmas tree”.

results.title: The Small farm in America
results.brief_description: An inquiry into the forces promoting large-scale agriculture while forcing small farmers off the land, a plea for a return to the small farm, and a look at some of those who are trying it. Suitable for upper secondary levels.
results.description: An inquiry into the forces promoting large-scale agriculture while forcing small farmers off the land, a plea for a return to the small farm, and a look at some of those who are trying it. Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Slipper and the Rose
results.brief_description: This is a captivating and enchanting musical version of the world’s best loved and most often told fairy-tale romance - Cinderella. The legendary appeal of this fairy-tale is captured on the night of the Palace Ball when Cinderella makes her breathtaking entrance. The Prince is entranced, but already it is midnight and Cinderella must vanish into the darkness, leaving behind only a tiny glass slipper.

results.title: The Slim Dusty Movie
results.brief_description: The story of a man who believed in a dream and the woman who stood by his side. The story continues today in the outback, in the rodeo arenas of the west, the frontier towns, the highway truck stops, the aboriginal tribal lands of the Red Centre and the largest concert halls in Australia. Every year they wait for him; from Alice Springs to Sydney, from Kunnamulla to Gundagai. The call him “the man with his hat turned down in front” - the man who is Australia - Slim Dusty.

results.title: The Slide rule: multiplication and division
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and F.E. Brooker
results.brief_description: Explains in detail the “C” and “D” scales of the slide rule showing enlarged views of the right and left indices, the hairline and the indicator. Shows how to use the two scales for multiplication, division and combinations of these two operations.
